commentary: Anderson to Dilshan, OUT but the bonus ball works! Anderson produces a gorgeous nip-backer that takes the inside edge to Buttler who holds a solid catch going to his left. commentary: Anderson to Thirimanne, OUT well, a step down the wicket, Anderson sees him coming and drops his length, Thirimanne goes through with the stroke aiming over cover but just nicks it to Buttler. Not the best choice of stroke it must be said. Came down the track too soon really and then didn't have the nous to pull out of the stroke. A little unlucky not to get more bat on that and send it over the slips but, you make your own luck!

commentary: Jordan to Mathews, OUT pitched up and Mathews is beaten on the drive, the umpire gives it... but, after a few moments of quizzical blinking, Mathews calls for the review. There was a thin sound on the replay, England all went up in unison; can't see what else it would have been, as Mathews was playing away from his body, bat above the ground as the ball went past... And Real-Time Snicko has picked up a sliver of audio, so the decision is upheld and Sri Lanka's captain trudges off
text: pitched up and Mathews is beaten on the drive, the umpire gives it... but, after a few moments of quizzical blinking, Mathews calls for the review. There was a thin sound on the replay, England all went up in unison; can't see what else it would have been, as Mathews was playing away from his body, bat above the ground as the ball went past... And Real-Time Snicko has picked up a sliver of audio, so the decision is upheld and Sri Lanka's captain trudges off

commentary: Jordan to Malinga, OUT pitched up, this stays a little low and clips Malinga on the back pad, in front of leg stump and that's good enough for Michael Gough, who raises the finger and drops the curtain on the Sri Lanka innings! Jordan gets his five-for, the first by an England bowler at Old Trafford

commentary: Senanayake to Cook, no run skids on and Cook misses playing across the line, Gough turns down the appeal for leg-before but Mathews wants a review... He was quite a long way back but the ball didn't really straighten, it was the wobble-seam carrom ball out of the front of the hand - and Hawk-Eye has it just clipping the top of leg but not enough to overturn the on-field call

commentary: Herath to Bell, SIX runs Bell wins it with a six, launches the ball down the ground and punches the air - England win by 10 wickets! They've exorcised the ghost of Lumley Castle, stuck a flake in their 99 and strolled to a 2-1 series lead in between the Manchester showers
